The `active_fields` is a bitmask that indicates what fields are being used.
â€“ When a field becomes optional later, existing transactions still serialize / merkleize the same.
â€“ When a new field is added, existing transactions still serialize / merkleize the same.

Serialization is similar to the SSZ Union, except with bitmask at start instead of an enum tag.
Merkleization ensures that common fields always end up having the same generalized index.

I have created https://eth-light.xyz (use a laptop, not mobile-friendly) to compare RLP vs `PartialContainer` based SSZ approach.
Can inspect RLP and SSZ serialization, size given on the SSZ button reflects the Snappy framed compression of the SSZ data.
